function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Traditional ieq monitoring protocol involving high-cost, invasive environmental sensors with limited spatial dimension and data storage.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Deficient traditional ieq measurement tools","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of ieq information interaction with occupants","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of synchronization between objective and subjective data in ieq studies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to achieve simultaneous data collection of objective ieq data and occupant opinions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous improvement and upgrading of the intelligent built environment monitor ibem since 2014","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contagious diseases transmission through shared mobile interface and web platform","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air quality monitoring","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of integration between objective and subjective ieq data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusion of only five sensors may limit the comprehensive monitoring of environmental parameters and miss potential risks to human health.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of sensors for chemical pollutants and noise levels may lead to undetected exposure to harmful substances and inadequate assessment of acoustic impacts on ieq.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assessing room acoustic performance in an unoccupied room with hvac running and closed windows may not accurately reflect real-life conditions for disease propagation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of immediate control means or technologies for acoustic environment in most buildings.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of noise levels may be less valuable in comparison with other indoor environmental quality ieq parameters.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Data transmission failure due to network interruption or device malfunction.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to visualize real-time ieq data due to display module malfunction.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temporary power supply failure leading to data loss or interruption in data transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interference from heat dissipation affecting accuracy of air temperature and humidity sensors","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate data transmission and storage architecture","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate software design for data presentation and human-computer interaction","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of multi-source data access increases the risk of spreading contagious diseases if proper hygiene and safety measures are not in place.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mobile interface and qr code scanning for building occupants may pose a risk of viral transmission if hygiene practices are not followed.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Real-time ieq data assessment through the mobile interface creates an environment for potential virus exposure among the occupants if proper sanitization measures are not in place.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement results not within the compliance range","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Weighting scheme not reflective of occupants’ priorities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lowered weight of illuminance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inability to measure noise level","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weighting scheme subject to revision","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited historical ieq data query on mobile interface less than one day","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Subjective bias in ieq voting module","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Passive acceptance of ratings leading to biased feedback","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Co-location of ibem devices with reference sensors in an office environment may lead to potential contamination and spread of contagious diseases if proper hygiene and cleaning protocols are not followed.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of dry ice and incense to create high co2 and pm2.5 concentrations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination from unoccupied room with broad ieq conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of variable refrigerant volume air conditioning system and humidifier for thermal environment control","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate co2 concentration and illuminance measurement due to lack of long-term baseline determination","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unreliable temperature, rh, and pm 2.5 concentration measurements due to fluctuating outdoor weather and other factors","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of misleading data due to inaccurate baseline measurements and lack of self-calibration validity under certain conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High occupancy density leading to increased risk of disease spread and infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient cleaning and sanitation leading to microbial contamination and disease transmission through fomites objects or surfaces .","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Imbalance between supply and demand in thermal environment control","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overheating in the cold zone during winter","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient heating in the hscw zone during winter","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Continuous monitoring of indoor thermal performance throughout the year may increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases within the building.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in the hospital building may lead to high co2 concentrations, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated pm 2.5 concentrations in the hospital building may indicate poor indoor air quality, posing health risks to occupants.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Thermal discomfort in the offices may lead to reduced productivity and occupant dissatisfaction.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation leading to high co2 concentrations in inpatient wards","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient air purification leading to high pm2.5 concentrations in various hospital areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
